page.title: List of Major League Baseball batting champions

rev.comment: This image use does not comply with [[WP:NFCC]] #10c and MUST be removed until it does. Thank you.
rev.diff:
Line 25: Line 25:
==American League==
==American League==
[[File:Nap Lajoie 1913.jpg|thumb|right|Nap Lajoie led the American League in its inaugural season with a .426 batting average, one of just 13 seasons of a .400+ average in the 20th century. In addition, Lajoie was a part of two separate contested batting average races in 1902 and 1910.|alt=A man with dark hair in a dark baseball cap and a white baseball jersey with "CLEVELAND" on the chest.]]
[[File:Nap Lajoie 1913.jpg|thumb|right|Nap Lajoie led the American League in its inaugural season with a .426 batting average, one of just 13 seasons of a .400+ average in the 20th century. In addition, Lajoie was a part of two separate contested batting average races in 1902 and 1910.|alt=A man with dark hair in a dark baseball cap and a white baseball jersey with "CLEVELAND" on the chest.]]
â
[[File:Lou-boudreau.jpg |180px|upright=3.| thumb|Hall of Famer [[Lou Boudreau]]]]
 
[[File:Boggs.JPG|thumb|right|Wade Boggs won four consecutive batting titles from 1985 to 1988.|alt=Wade Boggs wearing the 2008 American League All-Star uniform]]
[[File:Boggs.JPG|thumb|right|Wade Boggs won four consecutive batting titles from 1985 to 1988.|alt=Wade Boggs wearing the 2008 American League All-Star uniform]]
[[File:George Brett - USS Reagan - Feb 2009.jpg|thumb|right|George Brett's .390 batting average in 1980 is the second-highest since 1941, the last season in which a player hit .400.|alt=An older man with short gray hair in a black and white horizontally striped shirt looks to his left.]]
[[File:George Brett - USS Reagan - Feb 2009.jpg|thumb|right|George Brett's .390 batting average in 1980 is the second-highest since 1941, the last season in which a player hit .400.|alt=An older man with short gray hair in a black and white horizontally striped shirt looks to his left.]]
